org.spongepowered.api.text.format

Class TextStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.text.format.TextStyle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TextStyle.Base

    public class TextStyle
extends java.lang.Object
    A TextStyle represents an immutable text style of a Message. It is a utility that is not normally present in Minecraft.

    Combined styles can be created using TextStyles.of(TextStyle...) or using one of the and(TextStyle...), (TextStyle...) or negate() method.

    One can consider any given text style as a N-d vector where each dimension corresponds to one of the base text styles(this is why they are called base, for "basis vector"). Each dimension's value can be 1, 0, or -1, standing for applied, unapplied, and negated, represented by the TextStyle.TextStyleComponent enum. A TextStyle is like a vector with each component corresponding to the value of the corresponding dimension, a Base TextStyle.

    The adding of these vectors results in a TextStyle that is a composition of its basis text styles, and this is represented by the and(TextStyle...) operation. Negating a text style is like taking the negative of a vector, or multiplying all of its components by -1, and is represented by the negate() operation.

    Implementation note: the way TextStyles are serialized to the raw JSON format should be a component-wise serialization of the various bases into booleans.

    See Also:
    TextStyles

    • Method Detail

      • isComposite

        public boolean isComposite()
        Returns whether this text style is a composite of multiple text styles.
        Returns:
        True if this text style is a composite

      • is

        public boolean is(TextStyle style)
        Returns whether the given TextStyle is contained in this TextStyle.

        For example, a TextStyle with [Bold, Italic] would return true for is(TextStyles.BOLD) and is(TextStyles.ITALIC).

        If the specified TextStyle is a composite of multiple styles it returns true if this style has at least all of the properties set in the specified style.

        Parameters:
        style - The text style to check
        Returns:
        True if the given text style is contained in this text style

      • applied

        public TextStyle.TextStyleComponent applied(TextStyle.Base style)
        Checks for how the given Base TextStyle is applied in this composite. Any Base TextStyle that is not defined in the component map is automatically TextStyle.TextStyleComponent.UNAPPLIED.

        As examples, TextStyles.BOLD.applied(TextStyles.BOLD) results in TextStyleComponent.APPLIED, TextStyles.ITALICS.applied(TextStyles.BOLD) results in TextStyleComponent.UNAPPLIED, and TextStyles.BOLD.negate().applied(TextStyles.BOLD) results in TextStyleComponent.NEGATE

        Parameters:
        style - The given Base TextStyle
        Returns:
        The TextStyleComponent which represents the application of the given base text style
        See Also:
        TextStyle.TextStyleComponent

      • negate

        public TextStyle negate()
        Negates this TextStyle. This is useful for undoing text styles that are inherited from parent messages.
        Returns:
        The inverse of this text style

      • and

        public TextStyle and(TextStyle... styles)
        Composes this TextStyle with the specified text styles.
        Parameters:
        styles - The text styles to compose this one with
        Returns:
        A new text style composed out of the given text styles

      • andNot

        public TextStyle andNot(TextStyle... styles)
        Composes this TextStyle with the passed in TextStyles, but negates them before composition. This is the same as negating all the passed in TextStyle and then using the and(TextStyle...) method.
        Parameters:
        styles - The text styles to compose this one with
        Returns:
        A new text style composed out of the given text styles
